Class GraphDrawer

  • java.lang.Object
    • GraphDrawer

  • public abstract class GraphDrawer
extends java.lang.Object
    Class responsible for drawing graphs with different layouts. More precisely, it is possible to draw graphs with straight edges and graphs with semicircular edges.
    Version:
    1.0.0, 31st May 2019
    Author:
    Clemens Hofstadler

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      Size of the tip of the arrow drawn at the end of every edge.
      private static java.awt.Color markedNodeColor
      Color of a node when the user clicks on it.

    • Method Detail

      • drawGraph

        public static void drawGraph(java.awt.Graphics g,
                             Graph G,
                             int size,
                             boolean linearEdges)
        Draws a graph G on a graphics area of a certain size. Depending on the value of linearEdges the edges between the nodes are drawn as straight lines or as semicircles.
        Parameters:
        g - The drawing area on which the graph is drawn.
        G - The graph to be drawn.
        size - The size of the drawing area.
        linearEdges - Boolean value determining whether edges between the nodes are drawn as straight lines or as semicircles.

      • linearEdges

        public static void linearEdges(java.awt.Graphics g,
                               int size,
                               Graph G)
        Draws a graph G on a graphics area of a certain size, where the edges of the graph are drawn as straight edges.
        Parameters:
        g - The drawing area on which the graph is drawn.
        size - The size of the drawing area.
        G - The graph to be drawn.

      • drawLinearEdge

        private static void drawLinearEdge(java.awt.Graphics g,
                                   Graph G,
                                   int[] edge)
        Draws an edge of the graph G on the graphics area g. The edge is drawn as a straight line with an arrow at the tip.
        Parameters:
        g - The drawing area on which the graph is drawn.
        G - The graph to be drawn.
        edge - The edge to be drawn. The edge is given by two integer values (i,j), meaning that the edge starts at node_i and ends at node_j.

      • circularEdges

        public static void circularEdges(java.awt.Graphics g,
                                 int size,
                                 Graph G)
        Draws a graph G on a graphics area of a certain size, where the edges of the graph are drawn as semicircles.
        Parameters:
        g - The drawing area on which the graph is drawn.
        size - The size of the drawing area.
        G - The graph to be drawn.

      • drawCircularEdge

        private static void drawCircularEdge(java.awt.Graphics g,
                                     Graph G,
                                     int[] edge)
        Draws an edge of the graph G on the graphics area g. The edge is drawn as a semicircle with an arrow at the tip.
        Parameters:
        g - The drawing area on which the graph is drawn.
        G - The graph to be drawn.
        edge - The edge to be drawn. The edge is given by two integer values (i,j), meaning that the edge starts at node_i and ends at node_j.

      • drawNode

        private static void drawNode(java.awt.Graphics g,
                             Node n,
                             int radius)
        Draws a node as a black circle with a given radius on a graphics area.
        Parameters:
        g - The graphics area on which the node is drawn.
        n - The node to be drawn.
        radius - The radius of the node.

      • getRadius

        private static int getRadius(java.awt.Graphics g,
                             Graph G)
        Determines the radius of nodes of a graph G in relation to the size of the graphics area g.
        Parameters:
        g - The graphics area on which the graph should be drawn.
        G - The graph that should be drawn.
        Returns:
        The radius of the nodes.
